173.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sold a total of 9.6 million Tesla shares worth $8.5 billion this week. He offloaded about 4.4 million shares on April 26 and April 27. He sold an additional 5.2 million shares on April 28, new filings on Friday showed. The latest string of sales follows announcement of Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal.

174.title: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli buys Volvo XC40 worth ₹44.5 lakh, pic surfaces
174.article_body: SS Rajamouli recently bought a Volvo XC40 which is worth ₹44.50 lakh. A picture of the filmmaker receiving the car keys was shared online. Other than Volvo XC40, Rajamouli reportedly also has a Land Rover Range Rover and BMW 7 Series in his garage. Rajamouli's latest film 'RRR', starring Ram Charan and Jr NTR, earned more than ₹1,000 crore globally.

175.title: India reports 3,688 COVID-19 cases, 2,755 recoveries in last 24 hours
175.article_body: India reported 3,688 COVID-19 cases and 2,755 recoveries in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,377 COVID-19 cases and 2,496 recoveries. Active cases in India stand at 18,684, while the death toll has risen to 5,23,803.

176.title: Fighter pilot 'Ghost of Kyiv' killed in Ukraine war; identity revealed
176.article_body: Ukrainian fighter pilot known as 'Ghost of Kyiv' has been killed in the war in the country, Mayor of Kolomyia, Bogdan Stanislavsky announced. After his death, the identity of the pilot was revealed as Major Stepan Tarabalka, 29. Tarabalka lost his life when the MiG-29 he was flying was shot down while battling "overwhelming" enemy forces, Stanislavsky said.

177.title: Theft of Pakistani music continues: Singer Hadiqa on Kanika's 'Boohey Barian' rendition
177.article_body: After singer Kanika Kapoor released her rendition of 'Boohey Barian', Pakistani singer Hadiqa Kiani took to Instagram and said, "Another day and another shameless rendition of the song my mother wrote." "I am alive and well, if you want [to] sing my songs, ask me first," she added. She further wrote, "The theft of Pakistani music continues."

178.title: Please buy Swiggy so they can deliver on time: Shubman Gill to Elon Musk
178.article_body: Addressing the world's richest person Elon Musk, who is buying Twitter for $44 billion, cricketer Shubman Gill tweeted, "Please buy Swiggy so they can deliver on time. @elonmusk #swiggy." Reacting to his tweet, Swiggy Cares wrote, "Hi Shubman Gill. Twitter or no Twitter...we just want to make sure all is well with your orders (that is if you're ordering)."

179.title: Over $200 billion wiped off Amazon’s market value in its biggest 1-day drop since 2006
179.article_body: Amazon stock sank 14% in its biggest one-day drop since July 2006, with the shares closing on Friday at their lowest level since June 2020. With this, more than $200 billion was wiped off from the company's market valuation. This comes after the e-commerce giant reported quarterly loss for the first time in seven years.

180.title: Threads soaked in heroin worth ₹450 crore seized from Gujarat port; govt shares pic
180.article_body: Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad and the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence have recovered nearly 90 kilogram of heroin worth ₹450 crore from a shipping container that arrived at the Pipavav port in Amreli district from Iran. Threads were soaked in a solution containing heroin, which were then dried, made into bales and packed in bags for export, said Gujarat DGP Ashish Bhatia.

181.title: Delhi records second hottest April in 72 years: IMD
181.article_body: Delhi in 2022 recorded its second hottest April in 72 years, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Friday. The average maximum temperature during the month in the national capital stood at 40.2°C. Notably, Delhi on Thursday witnessed its warmest April day in 12 years amid heatwave, with the Safdarjung observatory recording a maximum temperature of 43.5°C, PTI reported.

182.title: It will spread a good message: AIMIM leader on inviting Raj Thackeray for Iftaar
182.article_body: AIMIM leader and Aurangabad MP Imtiaz Jaleel invited Raj Thackeray for an Iftaar party and said, "It will spread a good message in the country." "MNS chief Raj Thackeray is coming here for a rally on May 1. I invite him for Iftaar," he said. Jaleel further added that 99% of people are peace-loving, only 1% of people create disturbance.

183.title: Bengaluru records hottest day of the year on April 29 at 35.2°C
183.article_body: Bengaluru witnessed hottest day of the year on Friday (April 29) with city's maximum temperature touching 35.2°C. "This is not a heatwave as the temperature is just 1-2°C  above normal. For a heatwave, maximum temperature should be at least 4.5°C  above normal," IMD officials said. Bengaluru is expected to receive scattered rainfall in the coming days, IMD said.

184.title: Mobile internet services to be suspended from 9:30 am to 6 pm in Patiala today
184.article_body: Mobile internet services will be suspended from 9.30 am to 6 pm in Patiala today, according to an order by Principal Secretary, Home Affairs & Justice, Anurag Verma. This comes amid tensions after the violent clash between two groups in Patiala. Patiala Deputy Commissioner and SSP said that the data services could be grossly misused by certain unscrupulous elements.

185.title: If you don't speak Hindi leave this country and go: Sanjay Nishad
185.article_body: Responding to a media query about the ongoing language debate in the country, Uttar Pradesh Fisheries Minister Sanjay Nishad said that Hindustan is not a place for people who don't speak Hindi. "They should leave this country and go somewhere else," he said. "If you do not love Hindi, it will be assumed that you are a foreigner," he added.

186.title: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation clears ₹1,417 crore budget
186.article_body: The Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation's executive committee cleared their proposed budget, which has an expenditure of ₹1,417 crore, for the 2022-23 financial year in a meeting on Friday. The total budget expenditure will be spent on various civic segments including cleaning, streetlights and water supply, and the effective expenditure for 2022-23 will be around ₹900 crore, GMC officials said.

187.title: Husband stabs wife at TN court ahead of divorce hearing; arrested
187.article_body: A man has been arrested for allegedly attempting to murder his wife by stabbing her multiple times outside a court in Tamil Nadu's Perambalur on Friday. The accused and his wife, who got married 19 years ago, had filed an appeal to get divorced and were appearing for the hearing. The wife was taken to a government hospital for treatment.

188.title: Delhi HC grants ₹15 lakh to victim 25 yrs after Connaught Place shooting
188.article_body: Delhi High Court granted compensation of ₹15 lakh to a victim who was injured in the 1997 Connaught Place shooting. The injury due to state action needs to be considered at a "higher standard" than ordinary cases of negligence, HC said. The victim and his two friends were travelling in a car when a shootout involving Delhi Police took place.

189.title: Hyderabad's Alair Police Station adjudged best in T'gana, 5th in country
189.article_body: The Alair Police Station under Hyderabad's Rachakonda Commissionerate has been adjudged the best police station in Telangana by the Union Ministry of Home Affairs. It also ranked fifth among the top 75 police stations in the country. "The Telangana Police force has been striving to provide impeccable services to...citizens round the clock," Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat said.

190.title: Swiggy to pilot use of drones for Instamart deliveries
190.article_body: Swiggy has said it will pilot the use of drones for its online grocery service, Instamart, starting May. The drones will be used to replenish stocks between seller-run dark stores and from a store to a common customer point. The orders will then be picked by delivery partners who will deliver them to the customers.

191.title: 28-year-old woman killed in a hit-and-run accident in Pune
191.article_body: A woman (28) was killed in a road accident at Dukkar Khind in Pune's Warje area on Wednesday. The deceased, identified as Priyanka Ankush Mahajan, was riding a two-wheeler when she was hit by an unidentified vehicle which later fled the spot, police said. Notably, Mahajan was on her way to a job interview when the hit-and-run accident took place.

192.title: HC denies Labour Day procession request over traffic jams in B'luru
192.article_body: Karnataka High Court has denied a request by unions to hold a procession on the occasion of International Labour Day on May 1 in Bengaluru. The court said that a procession of 15,000 people on a Sunday during daytime would cause traffic congestion. The procession would have reportedly taken place from City Railway Station or Town Hall to Freedom Park.

193.title: Gold price dips as dollar climbs to 20-year high
193.article_body: Gold price extended loss for second successive week, logging biggest monthly drop in April since September 2021. On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), gold rate for June contract closed at ₹51,760 per 10 gram mark on Friday. As per experts, the dip came as dollar index sustained above 100 for entire week leading to USD climbing to 20-year high levels.

194.title: Bombay HC allows 2 death row convicts to pursue studies in jail
194.article_body: The Bombay High Court allowed two convicts in the case of Kopardi rape and murder of minor to pursue their studies through open university while in prison. The HC bench said that the convicts' desire to pursue education was "welcome" and directed the prison authorities to "adopt a humanitarian approach", and "extend necessary assistance" to help them pursue their studies.

195.title: 2 policemen demand ₹5,000 bribe over bail request in Pune; booked
195.article_body: The Pune unit of the Anti-Corruption Bureau has booked two police officers for allegedly demanding ₹5,000 as a bribe from a woman who was helping her colleague get bail. The accused were identified as sub-inspector Suresh Pundalik Gite and havaldar Santosh Sathe and are from the Shirur police station. The woman's colleague is booked in a criminal case.

196.title: Lemonade seller beaten to death after he uses 'stale' lemons in Ghaziabad
196.article_body: A lemonade seller was beaten to death in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad over payment issues following which an e-rickshaw driver was arrested, police said. The victim used stale lemons, the accused claimed. A scuffle broke out between the accused, who was with two other persons, and the victim. The lemonade seller was beaten with sticks and stones, his family alleged.

197.title: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy features on cover of TIME magazine
197.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has featured on the cover of TIME magazine amid the war in his country. The text on the magazine's cover reads, "How Zelenskyy leads: Inside the compound with the President and his team." "People see this war on Instagram, on social media. When they get sick of it, they will scroll away," he said.

198.title: Haryana CM meets Union Power Minister, discusses power supply issue
198.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar and Union Power Minister RK Singh met and it was agreed that 300 MW from the Kameng Hydro Electric project will be supplied to Haryana. "Haryana has decided to set up a new unit of 750 MW at its Yamuna Nagar plant for which the Ministry of Power will extend...assistance," the ministry's statement said.

199.title: Urge people to not be provoked: Captain Amarinder on Patiala clash
199.article_body: Expressing concerns over the situation in Punjab's Patiala, former CM Captain Amarinder Singh urged people to not get provoked. "People of Patiala are peace-loving...Hope that Punjab Police will take firm action and ensure that law and order are maintained," Captain tweeted. Tension prevailed after Shiv Sena members and pro-Khalistani activists clashed.

200.title: Punjab CM never met me over coal crisis: Union Coal Minister
200.article_body: Reacting to a comment made by AAP MP Raghav Chadha, Union Coal Minister Pralhad Joshi said that AAP "has a habit of lying." He added that Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann "never met" him to discuss the coal crisis. "They have never met me and they're saying that they have. [They are] taking my name and spreading lies," Joshi said.

201.title: Probe 23-yr-old basketball player's death: Kerala CM to Bihar CM
201.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Friday wrote a letter to his Bihar counterpart Nitish Kumar seeking "a comprehensive and fair investigation" into the alleged suicide of Lithara. She was a 23-year-old basketball player from Kerala employed in Indian Railways in Patna. The victim's family alleged she was being mentally harassed by her coach and she'd complained to them about it.

202.title: Bihar Police to use AI to nab gangs involved in banned liquor trade
202.article_body: Bihar Police is planning to introduce Artificial intelligence (AI) technology to help officers catch gangs or individuals involved in the banned liquor trade. The AI mechanism will make it "easy to identify...area of operations with real-time analytics and automated processes," police said. The Bihar Prohibition Act, imposed in 2016, bans the manufacture, sale and consumption of liquor.

203.title: LSG defeat PBKS to register their 6th win in IPL 2022, move to 3rd on the points table
203.article_body: LSG defeated PBKS by 20 runs to register their sixth win in IPL 2022. With the win, LSG have moved to the third position on the points table. PBKS have now lost five matches in the season. Quinton De Kock top-scored for LSG in the match with 46(37), while LSG pacer Mohsin Khan took three wickets.

204.title: EU border agency chief resigns amid accusations of rights abuse
204.article_body: The head of the European Union's border agency, Frontex, has resigned amid criticism of the treatment of migrants at the borders. Fabrice Leggeri is accused of tolerating illegal "pushbacks" of migrants, which violate the EU's obligations under international humanitarian law that prohibits returning people to where their lives would be at risk. Leggeri had dismissed the accusations in the past.

205.title: Seized heroin appeared in Flipkart packaging: CAIT as it seeks probe against firm
205.article_body: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) has sought an NCB investigation against Flipkart over its alleged role in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh drug racket busted by the NCB. "The seized heroin and other articles appeared in Flipkart packaging as per video and photos available on media," the CAIT said. "Flipkart's possible involvement in illegal activities...must not go unnoticed," it added.

206.title: Arshdeep should get a chance to play for India vs SA in T20Is: Sehwag
206.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said PBKS pacer Arshdeep Singh should be given a chance to play for India in their home T20I series against South Africa in June. "You'll know how he bowls against an international team...he'll get some experience too," he added. Arshdeep, who has taken three wickets so far, has an economy rate of 5.66 at death overs.

207.title: BJP did corruption in J'khand: Congress leader on power crisis
207.article_body: Blaming BJP for the ongoing power crisis in Jharkhand, Congress spokesperson Rakesh Sinha accused the BJP of corruption. "But what have they (BJP) done in these years? They have given nothing in the name of infrastructure to the state," he said. "They kept indulging in corrupt activities instead of providing infrastructure to the state", Sinha added.

208.title: US unlikely to eliminate coronavirus: Anthony Fauci
208.article_body: The coronavirus pandemic is not over and it is unlikely that the US will ever eliminate COVID-19, according to US President Joe Biden's Chief Medical Advisor Anthony Fauci. "By no means is it over. We still are experiencing a global pandemic," he said. Health officials are hoping to reach a point where COVID-19 can be controlled, he added.

209.title: Talks of BJP-MNS alliance are false: Devendra Fadnavis
209.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis dismissed reports of BJP's alliance with Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS). Fadnavis said there was no such proposal. "Yes, Raj Thackeray took issues of loudspeakers...that has been our issue...but alliance talks are false," he said. MNS's Yashwant Killedar also denied reports of an alliance between BJP and MNS.

210.title: 2 men robbed of ₹1.5 lakh at gunpoint in Punjab's Ludhiana
210.article_body: Two employees of a private firm were robbed of ₹1.5 lakh at gunpoint on Bhaini Gujra Link road in Ludhiana, Punjab. Ram Singh, who hails from Rajasthan, said that the miscreants injured the duo with sharp-edged weapons and threatened them at gunpoint. The police are scanning the footage of CCTV cameras installed to identify the culprits, sub-inspector Dalwinder Singh said.

211.title: India's peak power demand reaches all-time high of 207 GW amid heatwave
211.article_body: Amid a heatwave in India, the country's energy demand reached an all-time high of 2,07,111 MW (207 GW) at 02.50 pm on Friday, the Power Ministry said. This came after the peak power demand had reached a record 204.65 GW on Thursday. The peak power shortage recorded on Thursday was 10.77 GW.

212.title: It'd be a mistake to imagine Stokes as long-term Eng Test skipper: Atherton
212.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Atherton has said it would be a "mistake" to imagine Ben Stokes as a "long-term" choice for England Test skipper's role. "Having seen the way the job wears down even the toughest and flintiest of characters, there is no need for the same to happen to Stokes," he added. Stokes was appointed as Test captain on Thursday.

213.title: Cong leader meets Azam Khan's family, says 'SP didn’t stand with him'
213.article_body: Congress leader Pramod Krishnam on Thursday met jailed Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan’s family in UP's Rampur and said that SP didn't perform its duty to stand with him. He further urged BJP to reconsider its decisions citing Khan's ill health and said, "We're standing with him and his family. It should be seen from...perspective of humanity and not politics."

214.title: War showed Zelenskyy's true qualities to world: Ukraine Prez's wife
214.article_body: In an interview published on Friday, Ukraine's First Lady Olena Zelenska said that the war has revealed Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's true qualities to the world. "He has always been a man you can rely on. A man who'll never fail. Who'll hold out until the end," she added. Zelenska revealed she hasn't seen her husband since the conflict began.

215.title: Man shot at while trying to flee from police custody in Assam
215.article_body: A man in Assam's Cachar district, who was recently arrested for robbery, was shot at by police after he allegedly tried to escape. He sustained a bullet injury in his leg and has been admitted to hospital. The incident reportedly took place in Auliyatilla near Silchar town where he had been escorted by police in order to recover stolen motorcycles.

216.title: Who cares how much somebody spends on a house: Sunny on reports of buying ₹16cr house
216.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone, while reacting to reports of spending ₹16 crore on a three-bedroom penthouse in Mumbai, said, "I think it's the media's job to verify and figure out what needs to be put out. Who cares how much somebody spends on a house?" "People sometimes make s**t up just for the heck of it," she added.

217.title: Cheteshwar Pujara smashes 3rd hundred in 3 county matches
217.article_body: Cheteshwar Pujara on Friday smashed his third hundred in three matches for Sussex in the County Championship Division Two. Pujara is unbeaten on 128 off 198 deliveries after stumps on Day 2 of Sussex's match against Durham. Earlier in the season, Pujara had scored 109 runs against Worcestershire and 201* against Derbyshire.

218.title: First solar eclipse of 2022 to take place on April 30, NASA reveals locations
218.article_body: On April 30, people in some locations will have a chance to witness the first solar eclipse of the year. As it sets, the Sun will appear partially eclipsed in Chile, Argentina, most of Uruguay, western Paraguay, southwestern Bolivia, southeastern Peru and a small area of southwestern Brazil. It'll also be visible along parts of the northwestern coastline of Antarctica.

219.title: World's longest glass-bottomed bridge opens in Vietnam, pics surface
219.article_body: A 632-metre-long glass-bottomed bridge suspended 150 metres (490 feet) above a jungle has opened in Vietnam. The Bach Long ('White Dragon') pedestrian bridge is believed to be the world's longest glass-bottomed bridge and is located in Vietnam's northwest Son La province. Its floor is made from French-manufactured tempered glass, making it strong enough to support 450 people at a time.

220.title: There's nothing agricultural about Rahul's batting in IPL 2022: Gavaskar
220.article_body: Referring to KL Rahul's batting form in IPL 2022, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said the LSG captain has been outstanding. "The best part about Rahul's batting is that nothing is agricultural in his cricketing shots. Every shot that he plays is a proper textbook stroke," he added. With 374 runs from nine matches, Rahul is second-highest run-scorer so far.

221.title: Millions of honeybees die after being left on hot tarmac at US airport
221.article_body: Millions of bees that were set to be shipped to beekeepers across US' Alaska have died after they were left on a hot tarmac in Atlanta. Beekeepers who were waiting for the shipment called it "devastating". A beekeeper waiting for the shipment said that bees had escaped from their crates in the plane, so Delta Airlines had put them outside.

222.title: Elon Musk has lined up a new CEO for Twitter: Report
222.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, has lined up a new CEO for the company, Reuters reported. Musk earlier told Twitter Chairman Bret Taylor that he doesn't have confidence in Twitter's management. Twitter's current CEO Parag Agrawal will reportedly receive $42 million if he's terminated within 12 months of a change in control at Twitter.

223.title: Ex-US Marine killed fighting alongside Ukrainian forces in Ukraine
223.article_body: Former US Marine Willy Joseph Cancel was killed alongside Ukrainian forces this week, his relatives said, in the first known death of an American fighting in Ukraine. "He wanted to go over because he believed in what Ukraine was fighting for," Rebecca Cabrera, Cancel's mother, said. The US has warned Americans against going to Ukraine to fight the Russian forces.

224.title: EAM Jaishankar meets Bhutanese counterpart, hands over medical supplies
224.article_body: India's External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Friday met his Bhutanese counterpart Tandi Dorji and handed over medical supplies to him. Jaishankar said, "It's my honour to hand over the 12th consignment of medical supplies to Bhutan, as a gift from the government and people of India to...Bhutan." "We'll continue to stand...by your side through...post-COVID-19 sustainable recovery," he added.

225.title: 2 Chennai auto drivers fined ₹6,100 after abusing woman over fare
225.article_body: Two auto drivers in TN's Chennai, who reportedly abused a woman and her son and threw out their luggage after an argument over fare on Wednesday, have been fined a total of ₹6,100 by police. A passerby had shared a video of the incident on social media following which the city Commissioner directed officers to take action, an officer said.

226.title: 25 swords seized from auto in Maharashtra's Nanded, 2 arrested
226.article_body: Police in Maharashtra's Nanded on Friday recovered 25 swords that were being transported in an autorickshaw. Police had intercepted the auto after receiving information about two persons carrying a consignment of weapons. A boy and the owner of a gift shop were arrested and an investigation is underway. Earlier, police recovered 89 swords and a dagger in Dhule.

227.title: Wipro plans to hire 38,000 freshers in FY23
227.article_body: Wipro CEO Thierry Delaporte said the company hired over 19,000 freshers in FY22 and expects to double the number in FY23. Wipro added 45,416 employees on a year-on-year basis during the financial year, taking its total headcount to 2,43,128. The company said it plans to increase the frequency of promotion cycle for 70% employees in junior bands to quarterly basis.

228.title: He couldn't even become UP CM: Mayawati on Akhilesh's 'PM' remark
228.article_body: After Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said that he wanted BSP chief Mayawati to be PM, the latter reacted by saying, "They need to stop making such childish statements." She tweeted, "When (Akhilesh) couldn't fulfil his own dream of becoming (UP CM) even after securing...votes of Muslims and Yadavs...how would he manage to meet someone else's aspiration to become PM."

229.title: Sri Lankan Prez agreed to remove brother as PM: Ex-Prez Sirisena
229.article_body: Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has agreed to remove his older brother Mahinda Rajapaksa as the PM in a proposed interim government to solve a political impasse, ex-President Maithripala Sirisena said on Friday. The impasse was caused by the country's worst economic crisis in decades. The interim government will include all the parties in the Parliament, Sirisena added.

230.title: Bulldozers & swords given to people in name of religion: Mufti
230.article_body: PDP President Mehbooba Mufti on Friday said that people have been 'given bulldozers and swords in the name of religion'. She added that the situation was similar to a neighbouring country which "gave guns to people in name of religion". She further alleged that the Centre was 'pitting Hindus and Muslims against each other to hide job crisis and inflation'.

231.title: Will not do mankad unless the guy is properly cheating: LSG's Stoinis
231.article_body: On being asked if he would 'mankad' the batter, LSG all-rounder Marcus Stoinis said he won't do it unless the player is "properly cheating" at the non-strikers end. He added, "I'd probably tell him off first and ask him to stay in the crease." Stoinis has scored 73 runs and taken one wicket in five IPL 2022 matches so far.

232.title: Owaisi breaks down during speech, says 'Muslims are being wiped out'
232.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Friday broke down while addressing a gathering in Hyderabad and alleged that "Muslims are being wiped out of the country". Speaking on the bulldozer row, Owaisi said that he gets calls every day about the "instances of injustice" happening in India. "One shouldn't lose hope...We'll face it with patience but will never raze...home," he added.

233.title: Statehood demand for North Bengal justified: BJP MLA amid heatwave
233.article_body: Condemning West Bengal government's decision to announce early summer vacations in schools due to heatwave, BJP MLA Sankar Ghosh said the demand for separate statehood for North Bengal was "justified". He called North Bengal's weather "moderately pleasant". The "step-motherly" treatment of the TMC government towards North Bengal has led to this demand, he added.

234.title: Curfew imposed in Punjab's Patiala till 6 am tomorrow after 2 groups clash
234.article_body: Local authorities have imposed an 11-hour curfew in Punjab's Patiala after clashes broke out between two groups during an anti-Khalistan protest by Shiv Sena on Friday. The curfew, which was imposed from 7 pm, will remain in force till 6 am on Saturday. According to Patiala SSP, four persons, including two police personnel, have sustained injuries in the incident.

235.title: India's economy may take up to 13 years to recover from COVID-19 losses: RBI
235.article_body: India is expected to overcome the losses caused by the COVID-19 disruptions by 2034-35, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) stated in its report on currency and financing released on Friday. It further stated, "India suffered among the biggest pandemic induced losses in the world in terms of output, lives and livelihoods...Economic activity has barely recovered...even after two years."

236.title: Nobody else is bowling at 150 kmph in world right now: Steyn on SRH's Umran
236.article_body: SRH bowling coach Dale Steyn said the franchise's 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik will undoubtedly play for Team India in future as he's bowling at 150 kmph consistently in IPL 2022. "Nobody else is doing that in the world right now," he added. "I'm just trying to pat him on the shoulder and...encourage him when he bowls well," he further said.

237.title: Pregnant woman forced to drink toilet cleaner by husband in Telangana, dies
237.article_body: A pregnant woman in Telangana's Nizamabad district died on Wednesday after her husband forced her to drink toilet cleaner. The accused is on the run and police have formed teams to catch him. The woman's family members lodged a complaint against the accused and his family members alleging that they had harassed her for additional dowry.

238.title: MP-MLA couple's intent was to challenge law and order: Mumbai Police
238.article_body: Mumbai Police today opposed the bail pleas of Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana. Police claimed the couple's announcement to recite Hanuman Chalisa in front of CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence was with an intention to challenge law and order. Their acts were part of the larger conspiracy to get Maha Vikas Aghadi government dissolved, police added.

239.title: 182 COVID-19 cases reported at IIT Madras campus so far as 11 more test +ve
239.article_body: Eleven more persons have tested positive for COVID-19 at IIT Madras campus in Tamil Nadu, taking the total number of infected people to 182, state Health Secretary J Radhakrishnan informed on Friday. Radhakrishnan added that the campus hasn't been closed yet and government and campus authorities are trying to ensure that the COVID-19 cluster does not spread to other places.

240.title: 50 killed in a blast after Friday prayers at a mosque in Afghanistan
240.article_body: An explosion killed more than 50 worshippers after Friday prayers at a mosque in Afghanistan's Kabul, the head of the mosque said. The attack came as worshippers at the Sunni mosque gathered after Friday prayers for a congregation. Several mosques and cities are being targeted in Afghanistan during the Muslim holy month of Ramadan.

241.title: VHP, Bajrang Dal activists recite Hanuman Chalisa in support of temple in Agra
241.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) and Bajrang Dal activists on Friday recited the Hanuman Chalisa at the office of the Divisional Railway Manager (DRM) of North Central Railway's Agra division in Uttar Pradesh. As per reports, the activists were opposing any move to shift the Chamunda Devi temple from the platform of the Raja Ki Mandi railway station in the city.

242.title: Hindi is a link language: K'taka minister on nat'l language debate
242.article_body: Referring to Ajay Devgn and Kiccha Sudeep's exchange over the national language, Karnataka minister Dr CN Ashwathnarayan said, "Hindi is nothing but a link language." He said, "We need to love our language and at the same time, respect other languages and coexist." We are here to promote the local language as it is our identity, he added.

243.title: Putin, Zelenskyy accept Indonesia's invites to attend G20 summit
243.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy have accepted Indonesia's invites to G20 summit in November, amid calls by US and its allies to remove Russia from the grouping. Indonesia, the current chair of the G20, said that the war in Ukraine has impacted the recovery of the global economy. Notably, Ukraine is not a G20 member.

244.title: I’m not a major fan of it in all honesty: Russell on F1 sprint races
244.article_body: Mercedes' George Russell said he is "not a major fan" of F1 sprint races after the first sprint race of the season at the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix. There are three sprint races scheduled for this season, with a push by several teams to double that to six sprint races. Russell added sprint races should "probably be 50% longer".

245.title: BJP wants to create disturbance over louspeaker issue: Sanjay Raut
245.article_body:
Accusing the BJP of creating disturbance over the loudspeaker issue in Maharashtra,
Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said the BJP opposed an all-party meet called by the state government to discuss the issue. "[This] means you (BJP) want to do politics and want to create a disturbance on the matter of loudspeakers in [Maharashtra]," Sanjay Raut said.

246.title: Man Utd interim boss Rangnick appointed as Austria head coach
246.article_body: Manchester United on Friday said interim boss Ralf Rangnick has been appointed as the head coach of the Austrian national football team. United said Rangnick will join the national team at the end of May after the 2021-22 Premier League season ends. The club added Rangnick, 63, "will combine the job with his consultancy role at Old Trafford as planned."

247.title: Thousands take part in anti-Israel rallies on Jerusalem Day in Iran
247.article_body: Thousands of Iranians on Friday took part in rallies in Iran to mark the "Quds Day" (Jerusalem Day) for the first time since the coronavirus pandemic began. The day, being marked since 1979, is a way of showing support for the Palestinians. The demonstrators chanted "Death to Israel" and "Death to America" at the rally.

248.title: I think it should be Sanskrit: Kangana Ranaut on national language debate
248.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, while speaking on the national language debate, said, "If you ask me which language should be the national language, then I think it should be Sanskrit." "Sanskrit is older than Kannada, Tamil, Gujarati or Hindi. All these languages have come from Sanskrit. Then why hasn't Sanskrit become the national language?" she added.

249.title: 56-yr-old Odisha MLA appears for Class 10 board exam, says 'it was my wish'
249.article_body: BJD MLA from Odisha's Phulbani, Angada Kanhar, appeared for his Class 10 state board examination on Friday, at the age of 56. "I couldn't appear for the examination when I had to, due to various family issues...It was my wish to appear for the examination," he said. Kanhar appeared for the examination at a school along with 67 other students.

250.title: Ex-Tennis champion Boris Becker jailed for 2.5yrs for hiding assets after bankruptcy in UK
250.article_body: Former Wimbledon champion Boris Becker has been jailed for 2.5 years in the UK for hiding £2.5 million worth of assets and loans to avoid paying debts after being made bankrupt in June 2017. The 54-year-old was found guilty of four charges under the Insolvency Act and was cleared on 20 counts, the UK media reported.

251.title: Zerodha CEO's fake Insta ID used to scam user, he shares screenshot
251.article_body: Zerodha CEO and co-founder Nithin Kamath recently warned people of various types of frauds he has encountered and used his fake account as an example. He shared a screenshot of the fake Instagram page trying to scam a user with a "crypto scheme" promising to generate $10,000 in a week. "Phishing frauds' [number] has gone through the roof," he said.

252.title: Sakariya executed his plan perfectly to dismiss Finch: DC bowling coach
252.article_body: Praising Chetan Sakariya, who made his debut for DC against KKR in IPL 2022, DC bowling coach James Hopes said the pacer didn't miss a beat and executed his plan to perfection to dismiss Aaron Finch. The KKR opener was clean bowled in Sakariya's first over of the match after scoring a seven-ball three. He posted bowling figures of 3-0-17-1.

253.title: It doesn’t make sense: Belarus’ Victoria Azarenka on Wimbledon ban
253.article_body: Belarus' Victoria Azarenka said Wimbledon's decision to ban Russian and Belarusian players from participating "doesn't make sense". The All England Lawn Tennis Club made the decision following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, which has been termed as "discriminatory" by the ATP and the WTA. "I think there should be a reaction to that, that's all I want to say," Azarenka said.

254.title: US arrests British Virgin Islands Premier on drug trafficking charges
254.article_body: The US has arrested British Virgin Islands (BVI) Premier Andrew Fahie on charges related to drug trafficking and money laundering. Fahie agreed to allow a trafficker, an undercover agent, to use BVI ports to ship cocaine to the US in return for money, a statement said. BVI Governor John Rankin said, "I realise this will be shocking news for people."

255.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature today released
255.article_body: The IMD has released a list of cities that recorded more than 44°C as their maximum temperature on Friday. UP's Banda with 47.4°C recorded the highest maximum temperature, followed by 46.8°C in Prayagraj. Rajasthan's Ganganagar and Maharashtra's Chandrapur recorded maximum temperature of 46.4°C, while UP's Jhansi and Delhi's Sports Complex observatory recorded 46.2°C maximum temperature.

256.title: Man climbs atop mobile tower in Punjab, demands release of Sikh prisoners
256.article_body: A Sikh man climbed atop a mobile tower in Rode village of Punjab's Moga district on Friday, demanding justice for Sikhs across the country. His demands included the release of Sikh prisoners from jails across the country, justice in cases of sacrilege of the Sri Guru Granth Sahib and shifting of Khalistani extremist Jagtar Singh Hawara from Delhi's Tihar jail.

257.title: Make sure to conserve maximum energy: Du Plessis on playing in heat in IPL
257.article_body: Speaking about playing amid heat wave in Maharashtra in ongoing IPL 2022, RCB captain Faf du Plessis said he takes lots of fluids before the match, adding it's important to manage the intensity while practising. He added that one has to make sure to conserve maximum energy in hot conditions. RCB will face GT in an afternoon match on Saturday.

258.title: $170 billion wiped off Amazon's market value in its biggest drop since 2014
258.article_body: Shares of Amazon fell as much as 12% on Friday in its biggest intraday percentage drop since July 2014, wiping off about $170 billion from the company's market valuation. The company's shares declined after it reported a loss of $3.8 billion for Q1 2022, marking its first quarterly loss since 2015. Amazon also posted the slowest sales growth since 2001.

259.title: Won't let anyone create disturbance in Punjab: CM Mann on Patiala clashes
259.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Friday termed the incident of clashes in Patiala as "deeply unfortunate". CM Mann said, "We're closely monitoring the situation and will not let anyone create disturbance in the [state]. Punjab's peace and harmony [are] of utmost importance." Reportedly, stones were hurled and swords were brandished after clashes broke out between two groups in Patiala today.

260.title: SII's Covovax approved for COVID-19 vaccination of kids aged 12-17: Reports
260.article_body: Serum Institute of India's Covovax COVID-19 vaccine has been recommended for vaccination of children in the 12-17 years age group by NTAGI, multiple reports said on Friday. The vaccine was granted approval for restricted emergency use among adults on December 28, 2021 and among children aged 12-17 years, on March 9. SII had requested its inclusion in the vaccination drive.

261.title: Man arrested with foreign currency worth ₹59 lakh at Delhi's IGI Airport
261.article_body: The Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) on Friday seized foreign currency worth approximately ₹59 lakh from a passenger at Delhi's IGI Airport. Officials said $22,000 and 2,00,000 UAE Dirham were found concealed under the false bottom of the bag of the passenger, who was stopped based on suspicion. The man was kept under close watch through physical and electronic measures.

262.title: Trump posts for the 1st time on his Truth Social app, uses viral typo #COVFEFE
262.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump posted for the first time on his Truth Social app, months after its launch and wrote, "I'M BACK! #COVFEFE." The term referred to a typing error he made in his tweet about the press while he was the President. Trump was banned from Twitter in January last year after Capitol riots.

263.title: Change has come but for the worse: Nawazuddin amid KGF 2, RRR's success
263.article_body: Amid the success of 'KGF: Chapter 2' and 'RRR', actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui told NDTV that after over two years of delayed films and locked theatres, his hope was that audience would emerge from the pandemic with a refined taste for cinema. "I felt the audience would mature after the pandemic...Change has come but it's for the worse," he stated.

264.title: Nandan Nilekani is India's Elon Musk for me: Snapdeal CEO
264.article_body: Snapdeal CEO Kunal Bahl said that Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani is India's Elon Musk for him. "Whether it's Infosys, Aadhaar, UPI and now ONDC (Open Network for Digital Commerce), his impact on India and its global standing is nothing short of incredible," Bahl tweeted. While Nilekani's personality is distinct compared to Musk's, the quantum of his impact isn't, he added.

265.title: Sindhu reaches Badminton Asia Championships semis, confirms a medal
265.article_body: World number seven PV Sindhu assured herself of a medal at 2022 Badminton Asia Championships after entering semi-finals in Manila on Friday. Fourth-seeded Sindhu beat China's He Bing Jiao 21-9, 13-21, 21-19 in the quarter-final. Notably, Sindhu had won a bronze at the 2014 edition in Gimcheon. The 26-year-old Indian will face defending champion Japan's Akane Yamaguchi on Saturday.

266.title: LSG CEO Raghu Iyer, Gautam Gambhir's manager Gaurav Arora involved in minor road accident
266.article_body: LSG CEO Raghu Iyer, his associate Rachita Berry and franchise mentor Gautam Gambhir's manager Gaurav Arora were involved in a minor road accident today, the franchise said in a statement. The accident occurred when they were en route to the MCA Stadium in Pune for LSG's match against PBKS. "Fortunately, all three are safe and well," the franchise further stated.

267.title: Musk said he'll cut jobs at Twitter while securing bank loans for buyout: Reports
267.article_body: Elon Musk told banks he will crackdown on the salaries of Twitter executives and board members and develop new ways to monetise tweets, Reuters reported, quoting people familiar with the matter. Musk specifically mentioned job cuts as a part of his pitch to the banks to secure debt for the buyout, reports said. He took Twitter private for $44 billion.

268.title: PBKS to bowl first against LSG, Avesh Khan replaces Manish Pandey
268.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal won the toss and elected to bowl first against LSG in their IPL 2022 clash on Friday. PBKS are fielding an unchanged playing XI, while LSG have replaced Manish Pandey with Avesh Khan. LSG are currently placed fourth on the points table, while PBKS are seventh.

269.title: Cybercriminals using Collector's photo as WhatsApp DPs: Hyd Police
269.article_body: Hyderabad Police put out an alert on Twitter asking users to stay alert as cybercriminals have been using District Collector's photo as their WhatsApp display pictures to cheat people. "Cybercriminals... (are) sending messages for financial help. Beware," Hyderabad City Police tweeted. "Do not believe such messages and do not be cheated", the police added.

270.title: Shiv Sena suspends Harish Singla after clashes during rally in Patiala
270.article_body: Shiv Sena has suspended the working president of its Punjab unit, Harish Singla, for "anti-party activities", according to an official letter issued by the party today. This comes after clashes broke out between two groups during Shiv Sena's anti-Khalistan rally in Patiala. The rally was being led by Singla and was reportedly held without a "go ahead" from the party.

271.title: Mumbai AC local trains' ticket prices cut by 50%, 5 km-journey to cost ₹30
271.article_body: Union Minister of State for Railways, Raosaheb Patil Danve, on Friday announced a 50% reduction in the ticket prices of air-conditioned local trains in Mumbai. According to him, the existing minimum fare of ₹65 for a distance of five kilometres will be reduced to ₹30. Danve further said that the fare reduction was a long-pending demand of the public.

272.title: RR to wear special jersey tomorrow to honour Shane Warne, share pics
272.article_body: RR will wear a special jersey in their IPL 2022 match against MI at the DY Patil Stadium in Mumbai tomorrow to honour late Australian spin legend Shane Warne. The players will sport initials 'SW23' on the leading collar of their shirts as a tribute to Warne. RR had won the inaugural season of IPL in 2008 under Warne's captaincy.

273.title: We're very excited that Nadal is here: Madrid Masters director Lopez
273.article_body: Madrid Masters tournament director Feliciano Lopez said everyone is excited about five-time champion Rafael Nadal playing in the tournament, beginning Sunday. "I have hopes that we can see him 100% on Wednesday," he added. The 35-year-old, who is 20-1 this season, hasn't played since losing in Indian Wells Masters final last month. He had injured his rib in semi-finals.

274.title: N Korea halts freight train services with China over COVID outbreak
274.article_body: The freight train services between China and North Korea have been suspended in response to a COVID-19 outbreak in the Chinese border city of Dandong. Local authorities have locked down 77 residential compounds in response to the outbreak that began in late April. The move comes within four months of North Korea easing the border lockdown enforced in 2020.

275.title: 22-yr-old jumps from 1st floor of Punjab showroom as 18-yr-old man tries to rape her
275.article_body: A 22-year-old woman sustained several injuries after she jumped from the first floor of a showroom in Punjab's Jamalpur allegedly after an 18-year-old man tried to rape her. "The accused found the woman alone at the shop and barged inside on the pretext of porting his mobile number," police said. The accused has been arrested.

276.title: Fuel price hike lowest under PM Modi's regime: Union minister Hardeep Puri
276.article_body: Union Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Friday said fuel price hike under the PM Narendra Modi-led government had been the lowest. "Basic salaries have increased over decades...The government is giving free schemes to people under various categories," he added. "The PM has advocated for the best spirit of cooperative federalism pertaining to the issue of livelihoods," the minister said.

277.title: PM Modi wears turban as he hosts Sikh delegation at his residence, pic surfaces
277.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday hosted a Sikh delegation and addressed them at his residence in Delhi. Visuals from the event showed PM Modi sporting a turban as he greeted the delegation. "Going to Gurudwaras, spending time in service, getting langar, staying at the homes of Sikh families have been a part of my life," he said.

278.title: Tamil Nadu passes resolution urging Centre to allow it to send aid to Sri Lanka
278.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Assembly on Friday unanimously passed a resolution urging the Centre to permit the state government to send essential commodities, including rice, pulses, dairy products and medicines, to Sri Lanka, amid the ongoing economic crisis. "We can't see the development in Sri Lanka as the neighbouring country's internal issue...Help should be prompt, on time," CM MK Stalin said.

279.title: MP hospital lift with patient, 6 others gets stuck for an hour
279.article_body: Seven persons, including an elderly patient on oxygen, were allegedly stuck for an hour in the lift of Shalby Hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Thursday. "We boarded the lift from...ninth floor and it got stuck on...tenth floor," a visitor said, adding, that the patient faced breathing difficulties. The hospital however claimed that the lift was opened in five minutes.

280.title: I-T official dies after SUV crashes head-on with her scooter in MP
280.article_body: A 59-year-old income tax official died after an SUV collided with her scooter head-on in MP's Bhopal on Thursday, police said. The victim, Sunita Chouhan, sustained severe head injuries after the crash and died in hospital during treatment. Police have obtained a picture of the car and are currently looking for the driver who fled after the accident.

281.title: He said 'just 1 kiss?': Another woman accuses Vijay Babu of sexual misconduct
281.article_body: After an actress accused Malayalam actor Vijay Babu of raping her, another woman has come forward to accuse him of behaving inappropriately with her in 2021. "[Vijay and I] met for a work-related thing...Suddenly he leaned to kiss me on my lips...without any consent," she alleged. "I pulled myself backwards...he then asked me 'Just one kiss?' I...said no," she added.

282.title: 18,000 kg of chicken nuggets from overturned truck closes US highway; pic surfaces
282.article_body: A highway in the US was closed for several hours this week after a tractor-trailer overturned and spilled chicken nuggets onto the road. Police say the tractor-trailer was carrying 40,000 pounds (over 18,000 kg) of frozen nuggets when the driver lost control. The driver was not injured. Crews remained on the scene for hours to clean up the chicken.

283.title: Gadkari inaugurates 12 National Highway projects worth ₹8,000 crore in Hyd
283.article_body: Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Friday inaugurated 12 National Highway (NH) projects worth ₹8,000 crore and seven Central Road Infrastructure Fund (CRIF) projects in Hyderabad. The NH projects, with a combined length of 460 km, will boost inter-state connectivity by enabling seamless travel from Telangana to Maharashtra, Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh.

284.title: Shah Faesal will serve same govt that imprisoned him: Omar Abdullah
284.article_body: Former J&K CM and National Conference leader Omar Abdullah on Friday congratulated former IAS officer Shah Faesal on his return to the government service. He, however, added that Faesal will now be serving the same government that imprisoned him. Faesal, who had quit the government service in 2019 citing 'rising intolerance' in India, was detained after Article 370 was abrogated.

285.title: Bengaluru police arrest 4 drug peddlers, seize ganja worth ₹1.5 lakh
285.article_body: The Central Crime Branch of Bengaluru police have arrested four Kerala-based drug peddlers, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Thursday. Police have recovered 2 kilograms of ganja, which is estimated to be worth around ₹1.5 lakh, from their possession. Further, police have also recovered four mobile phones and an electronic weighing machine from their possession.

286.title: Russian submarine strikes Ukrainian targets with cruise missiles
286.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry has said that a Russian submarine in the Black Sea carried out missile strikes against Ukrainian military targets. The ministry also released a video of Kalibr cruise missiles being launched from the sea. Notably, this is the first time Russia has announced the use of its submarine fleet to hit Ukrainian targets, according to reports.

287.title: Lt General BS Raju appointed as new Vice Chief of Army Staff
287.article_body: Lieutenant General BS Raju has been appointed as the new Vice Chief of Army Staff. Lt General Raju is currently serving as the Director-General of Military Operations. The appointment is reportedly a rare instance of an officer who's not been an Army Commander, getting appointed as the Vice Chief. He will take charge on May 1.

288.title: I don't like watching my films as I feel I could've done better: Ajay Devgn
288.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn said he doesn't like watching his films after a few months of release as he feels he could have done better. The actor, who recently appeared in 'RRR' and 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', said he hasn't watched either of the films. "I feel like I must have done terrible work and I don't want to watch it," Ajay added.

289.title: Papa said 'you'll find mother dead when you return': Daughters on UP BJP leader's death
289.article_body: After BJP leader Shweta Singh Gaur's dead body was found in her room in Uttar Pradesh's Banda, her daughters accused their father Deepak Singh Gaur, grandfather and other family members of murder. "Papa said that when you come back from school, you will find your mother dead...He wanted a son...They killed my mother," the daughters said.

290.title: Benedict Cumberbatch to host Ukrainian family who fled amid Russian invasion
290.article_body: Benedict Cumberbatch, in an interview with Sky News, confirmed that he's welcoming a Ukrainian family, who fled amid the Russian invasion, to his UK home. "I want to give them some stability after the turmoil that they've experienced...that's within my home," Cumberbatch said. The actor also revealed that he is helping other refugees by covering their housing costs in UK.

291.title: Australia squad for Sri Lanka series announced, Cummins rested for T20Is
291.article_body: Test captain Pat Cummins has been rested from the T20I squad from Australia's all-format tour of Sri Lanka in June and July. Marcus Harris, opener in four out of five Tests in Ashes series, was dropped from the Test squad. Spinner Adam Zampa will miss the tour as he's awaiting fatherhood. Tour comprises three T20Is, five ODIs and two Tests.

292.title: World no. 7 Ruud beats Molcan to reach BMW Open quarter-finals
292.article_body: World number seven Casper Ruud on Thursday beat Alex Molcan 3-6, 6-4, 6-4 to reach the quarter-finals of the BMW Open in Munich. "It was a very tough test. I didn't get off to a great start," Ruud said. "It gives me confidence I am able to win matches like these," he added. Ruud, 23, reached the semi-finals last year.

293.title: Cristiano Ronaldo scores to help Man Utd draw 1-1 with Chelsea in PL
293.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo scored to help Manchester United draw 1-1 with Chelsea in the Premier League on Thursday. Ronaldo scored in the 62nd minute after Marcos Alonso gave Chelsea the lead in the 60th minute. Chelsea are currently third on the Premier League table with 66 points in 33 games. Chelsea will face Everton next in the Premier League on Sunday.

294.title: China to allow 'some' Indian students' return after India suspends Chinese visas
294.article_body: China will permit some Indian students to return for their studies, over two years after visa and flight restrictions were imposed due to COVID-19, the country's Foreign Ministry has said. "China attaches high importance to Indian students' concerns about returning," it added. This came after India suspended Chinese nationals' tourist visas, following its refusal to let Indian students return.

295.title: 64 villagers booked for killing leopard, attacking public servants in UP
295.article_body: As many as 64 people, including 10 women, were booked in connection with the killing of a three-year-old leopard by villagers in Katarniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich, police said. The incident took place after the leopard allegedly injured 13 villagers inside the sanctuary. The accused also allegedly attacked public servants and obstructed government work, the DFO said.

296.title: Pankaj remembers Irrfan on death anniversary, says 'I've only watched his films'
296.article_body: Remembering Irrfan Khan on his second death anniversary, Pankaj Tripathi said, "I get emotional every time I'm asked to talk about him." "Be it for craft, intellect, on-screen and off-screen behaviour, how to view acting, he has inspired everyone immensely," he said, adding, "When he acted, it made us take note of how he did it...I've only watched Irrfan's films."

297.title: 31-yr-old key accused in Jahangirpuri violence sent to 2-day police custody
297.article_body: A Delhi court has sent Fareed alias Neetu, one of the main accused in Jahangirpuri violence, to two-day police custody. Delhi Police Crime Branch had arrested 31-year-old Fareed from West Bengal. Police have alleged that he's "one of the conspirators" and was "seen firing at the other community" during the clashes that erupted during a Hanuman Jayanti rally in Jahangirpuri.

298.title: Assam court grants bail to Guj MLA Mevani in policewoman assault case
298.article_body: An Assam court has granted bail to Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani in a case of alleged assault on a policewoman. "He is likely to be released...[on Saturday]," Mevani's legal counsel Angshuman Bora said. Notably, Mevani was re-arrested in the assault case on Monday just after being granted bail in another case related to alleged objectionable tweets about PM Narendra Modi.

299.title: Shahid, Ishaan could've turned losers after my failed marriages: Mom Neliima
299.article_body: Neliima Azeem, mother of Shahid Kapoor and Ishaan Khatter, said, "My sons...[faced] a lot of challenges because, unfortunately, both my marriages failed." "I was extremely busy with (work)...I was bread earner...There were ups and downs," she said, adding, "My children shone through it all. For that, I give them an extra badge, because they...could've been losers also because of it."

300.title: If Umran remains hell bent on not reducing his pace, it won't work: Munaf
300.article_body: Ex-India pacer Munaf Patel said it "won't work" if SRH pacer Umran Malik remains "hell bent" on not reducing his pace at any cost. "You have to bowl in our conditions which are not ideal for fast bowling," added Munaf. "If he can focus more on line and length like Dale Steyn...then no one can stop him," stated Munaf.

301.title: Sidhu lauds Punjab govt as it frees 29 acres of encroached land in Mohali
301.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu lauded the Punjab government for freeing 29 acres of encroached land in Mohali. The land had been encroached on since 2007, the Department of Rural Development and Panchayats said. "My accolades to Panchayat Minister Kuldeep Dhaliwal...This is the way forward for Punjab...seize properties of...illegal...occupants, no matter who they are," Sidhu tweeted.

302.title: Pune's Pataleshwar temple faces acute shortage of water
302.article_body: Pune's Pataleshwar cave temple is facing an acute shortage of water amid heat wave-like conditions in the city. The Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) has now requested the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) to provide a new water supply connection to the monument. "It has become difficult to manage the daily operations with the existing supply," an ASI official said.

303.title: He promised his mom he'll take them out of poverty: Ian Bishop on DC's Rovman Powell
303.article_body: Talking about Delhi Capitals (DC) batter Rovman Powell, Ian Bishop said, "He has come from humble beginnings. He promised his mom that he will take them out of poverty when he was still in secondary school." He added, "He is living that dream to do that." Rovman was bought by DC for ₹2.8 crore in the mega auction.

304.title: Not ready to move on: Babil remembers dad Irrfan on his death anniversary
304.article_body: Actor Babil Khan on Friday penned a post remembering his late father Irrfan Khan on his second death anniversary. "I'm not ready to move on...and I'm alright with the idea that...I will never be...You still breathe, in my thoughts," Babil wrote on Instagram while sharing a picture of the late actor. Irrfan was diagnosed with neuroendocrine cancer in 2018.

305.title: Liverpool’s Mohamed Salah named England’s Men’s Footballer of the Year
305.article_body: Liverpool's Mohamed Salah on Friday was named England's Men's Footballer of the Year in the annual vote by the Football Writers' Association (FWA). Salah got 48% of the votes ahead of Manchester City's Kevin De Bruyne and West Ham United's Declan Rice. Salah, 29, has registered 30 goals and 14 assists in 44 appearances for Liverpool this season.

306.title: Man gets 8 yrs rigorous imprisonment for raping deaf-mute girl in J&K
306.article_body: A court in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur convicted a man of raping a deaf and mute girl and sentenced him to 8 years of rigorous imprisonment on Thursday. The convict, Karnail Singh, had barged into the girl's house six years ago and gagged and raped her, the officials said. A fine of ₹35,000 has also been imposed on him.

307.title: Zomato shares hit all-time low, wipe out half of investor wealth in 4 months
307.article_body: Shares of Zomato hit an all-time low of ₹71.15 on Friday, slipping below the lower band of IPO price in nine months since its stock market debut. Zomato has wiped out almost half of its investors' wealth since January 3, when its stock hit a high of ₹142.45. The food delivery platform's shares are down more than 15% this month.

308.title: Tibet Prez compares Nehru's policy to that after 2014, blames Nehru's faith in China
308.article_body: Central Tibetan Administration President Penpa Tsering compared Jawaharlal Nehru's policy of recognising China's sovereignty over Tibet to that in India after 2014. Tsering said Nehru had "too much faith" in China and "he did what he thought was best for India". "I think India has changed his policy by not repeating that Tibet is part of [China]," he stated.

309.title: I won't question or beg the captain for the ball: KKR's Andre Russell
309.article_body: KKR all-rounder Andre Russell said he wants to contribute more with the ball for his team in IPL 2022, but won't "question or beg" captain Shreyas Iyer for the ball. "I think everyone knows how important these last couple of games are," added Russell. Russell has picked 10 wickets in IPL 2022 so far.

310.title: Insurtech startup Turtlemint raises $120 mn, reportedly at $900 mn valuation
310.article_body: Insurtech platform Turtlemint has raised $120 million in a Series E round led by Amansa Capital, Jungle Ventures and Nexus Venture Partners. The platform has closed the current financing round reportedly at a $900-950 million valuation. The round also saw participation from new investors Vitruvian Partners and Marshall Wace, along with other existing investors.

311.title: Ajay would give 1 shot & go back to being director: Rakul on Runway 34
311.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh, speaking about 'Runway 34' co-star and director Ajay Devgn, said, "He was taking care of so many things." "From setting up, doing rehearsals, picturing every angle, every light to ensuring everything was bang on, he was more of...director," Rakul said, adding, "Then he'd just come to give one shot in a second and go back to being...director."

312.title: I'm sure Rohit, Kohli will get back in form in IPL 2022: Ganguly
312.article_body: Speaking about Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's batting performance in ongoing IPL, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said he's sure both will get back in form in the upcoming matches. MI captain Rohit has scored 153 runs from eight matches at an average of 19.13, while ex-RCB skipper Kohli has managed 128 in nine matches, averaging 16.00, so far.

313.title: Around 8,000 British troops to take part in exercises in Europe: UK
313.article_body: Britain's Ministry of Defence on Friday said around 8,000 British Army troops will take part in exercises across eastern Europe in one of the largest deployments since the Cold War. Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said British service personnel will join with NATO allies for exercises amid Russia's ongoing invasion of Ukraine, which began on February 24.

314.title: Pakistani 'Made in China' drone shot down by BSF troops in Punjab
314.article_body: A Pakistani quadcopter was shot down by BSF troops near Dhanoe Kalan in Punjab's Amritsar on Friday. The BSF said that troops deployed at the border intercepted the drone after they heard a buzzing sound of a suspected flying object entering India from Pakistan around 1.15 am. The 'Made in China' drone was recovered after an intensive search, it added.

315.title: 2 men killed, 3 others injured in collision between 2 cars in Pune
315.article_body: Two men were killed and three others were severely injured in a collision between two cars near Pune's Kavdipath toll plaza area. According to police, the accident took place when the driver of one of the cars rammed into the other car from the side. A case has been registered against the unidentified car driver for rash driving.

316.title: Over 14,000 Bangladeshi nationals sent back since 2019: BSF report
316.article_body: Over 14,000 Bangladeshi nationals have been sent back from the Indo-Bangladesh border since 2019, a BSF report said. It said at least 9,233 Bangladeshis were held at International Border while trying to flee after their illegal stay. "At least 4,896 Bangladeshi nationals were held while trying to enter India between January 1, 2019 and April 28, 2022," BSF report added.

317.title: LIC likely to list shares on exchanges on May 17
317.article_body: The shares of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) are likely to list on the stock exchanges on May 17. The IPO, which will be India's biggest ever, will open for subscription on May 4 and close on May 9. The government is expecting to raise ₹20,557 crore by diluting its 3.5% stake through the IPO.

318.title: CID arrests BJP's Divya Hagargi in Karnataka PSI recruitment scam
318.article_body: BJP leader Divya Hagargi was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) in connection with the Police Sub-Inspector (PSI) recruitment scam in Karnataka. Divya was reportedly caught from a hideout in Pune in Maharashtra. She runs Jnana Jyothi Institution which is an educational institution in Kalaburagi and was the 18th accused to be arrested in the case.

319.title: Open to buying if terms are right: Petroleum Minister on importing oil
319.article_body: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri said, India is open to buying oil from other countries as we've to look after our interests. "We're situated close to gulf countries like Iran which has lot of oil...We've energy relations with Russia, we buy crude from them but our total imports are not more than 0.2%," Puri added.

320.title: MP class 10, 12 board results released; 3.55 lakh class 10 students declared failed
320.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Board of Secondary Education on Friday declared results for classes 10 and 12. The Class 10 pass percentage is 59.54% and Class 12 pass percentage is 72.72%. A total of 3,55,371 Class 10 candidates have been declared failed. The last time the pass percentage was recorded below 60% for MP Class 10 board exam was in 2017.

321.title: Naga Chaitanya to make OTT debut with Prime Video's Telugu series 'Dhootha'
321.article_body: Naga Chaitanya will make his OTT debut with Prime Video's Telugu series 'Dhootha'. The actor's first look from the series, which is a supernatural horror thriller, was shared by Amazon Prime Video on Thursday. "As [an] actor, we always crave for our work to get maximum exposure and on a platform like Prime Video, we get that exposure," Chaitanya said.

322.title: Tata aims to build 80,000 EVs this financial year: Reuters
322.article_body: Tata Motors plans to ramp up its EV production and produce nearly 80,000 EVs in the current financial year, Reuters reported. The firm built and sold 19,000 EVs in the last financial year. At present, Tata Motors reportedly accounts for 90% of EV sales in India. The firm announced plans last year to launch 10 EV models by March 2026.

323.title: Woman injured in celebratory firing in Delhi, accused son absconding
323.article_body: A 54-year-old woman sustained bullet injuries during a celebratory firing at a wedding function at Matangi Bhawan in Delhi's Chhattarpur mandir on Thursday. The accused, who is absconding, is the woman's son, police confirmed. The injured woman was unconscious and unresponsive when the police reached the hospital to take her statement, a doctor said.

324.title: Global COVID-19 cases, deaths continue to decline since end of March
324.article_body: In its weekly report, the World Health Organization said global COVID-19 cases and deaths continued to drop since the end of March 2022. WHO said during the week of April 18 through April 24, over 4.5 million cases and over 15,000 deaths were reported globally, which is a decrease of 21% and 20%, respectively when compared to the previous week.

325.title: Greater demand for Alphonso mangoes in US this year: Exporters
325.article_body: The mango exporters of India said that for the first time there is a greater demand for Alphonso mango in US this year, compared to the traditional Kesar mango. "At the start of the season, we were apprehensive and so export volumes were lower than usual. However, US consumers lapped up the mangoes which went from India," an exporter said.

326.title: Gurugram witnesses hottest April day in over 40 years at 45.6°C
326.article_body: Gurugram on Thursday witnessed its hottest day in April in over 40 years at 45.6 degrees Celsius, according to the India Meteorological Department data. Gurugram had recorded the highest maximum temperature of 44.8 degrees Celsius in the month of April in 1979. Notably, IMD has issued a heatwave alert for south Haryana districts, including Gurugram, for the next four days.

327.title: Chhavi Mittal shares pics with husband from hospital on anniversary, pens note
327.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal, who recently underwent a six-hour-long surgery for breast cancer, celebrated her 17th wedding anniversary with her husband, Mohit Hussein, in hospital on Friday. Sharing some pictures with Mohit, she wrote, "I would choose you 100 times over as my life partner because the way you have stuck with me through everything, I don't think anyone could've."

328.title: South Korea to lift outdoor mask mandate
328.article_body: South Korea will lift an outdoor mask mandate starting next week. Health authorities said people will still be required to wear masks at outdoor gatherings of over 50 people and sporting and cultural events with potentially large crowds. South Korea reported 50,568 new COVID-19 cases on Friday. The country had removed most of its COVID-19 restrictions earlier this month.

329.title: HC adjourns hearing of Umar Khalid's bail plea to May 6 in Delhi riots case
329.article_body: Delhi High Court on Friday adjourned Umar Khalid's bail plea hearing in connection with the 2020 Delhi riots case to May 6. "Section 124A of the Indian Penal Code is under challenge before the Supreme Court and is coming up for hearing on May 5. The findings on the 124A will have bearing on these cases as well," HC said.

330.title: Man hangs self after killing wife, 3-month-old daughter in UP's Bareilly
330.article_body: A 26-year-old man allegedly hanged himself after killing his 24-year-old wife and their three-month-old daughter in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly, police said. The incident came to light when the family members broke open the door when no one came out till late in the morning, police added. Prima facie it appears that the man died by suicide, police stated.

331.title: It was a tough start, but I was in form: Powell after win against KKR
331.article_body: Delhi Capitals batter Rovman Powell has said that he had to face a "tough start" during his match-winning knock of 33*(16) against KKR on Thursday. "Yeah, it was a tough start, but I was in form. In the early part of the season, I was going out for like one ball, two balls and those kinds of stuff," Powell said.

332.title: We see Rovman Powell as a finisher: DC skipper Rishabh Pant
332.article_body: After scoring an unbeaten 33(16) against KKR, Delhi Capitals skipper Rishabh Pant said that they consider batter Rovman Powell as a "finisher" for the franchise. "Like today when we lost too many wickets, he (Powell) had to come up and do the job. We are not thinking about the points table and taking one game at a time," Pant said.

333.title: Depp's bodyguard asked in court about seeing him urinate, actor's reaction goes viral
333.article_body: Johnny Depp burst out laughing after his bodyguard Malcolm Connolly was asked in court if he had seen the actor urinate. Connolly replied 'No' to the question. "Mr Depp had his penis out of his pants, didn't he?" he was further asked, to which Connolly replied, "I think I'd remember if I'd seen Mr Depp's penis."

334.title: After failing to make it, Army aspirant dies by suicide in Haryana
334.article_body: An Army aspirant (23) died by suicide at the premises of a government school in a village in Haryana's Bhiwani district. According to the police, the aspirant had appeared in three Army recruitment drives but failed to make it to the final cut-off. The youngster's father claimed that the deceased had even crossed the age limit for eligibility as well.

335.title: Momentum turned after Umesh started with a wicket but gave 11 runs: Shreyas
335.article_body: Discussing KKR's defeat against DC by four wickets, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said, "[Pacer] Umesh Yadav started with a wicket but gave away 11 runs in the [first] over, that's where...the momentum turned." "You need to sit back and think where it's going wrong, can't be overconfident," added Shreyas. KKR are currently eighth on the IPL 2022 points table.

336.title: Mercedes looking at energy options should Russia cut gas delivery: CEO
336.article_body: Mercedes-Benz is looking at energy alternatives should Russia cut gas deliveries, CEO Ola Kaellenius said. "Every company is looking at options for diversifying energy sources," Kaellenius said. The automaker is working closely with German authorities to ensure energy supplies. "It is still too early to say exactly which scenario will happen," Kaellenius added.

337.title: Everything about it was wrong: Ponting on DC-RR no-ball controversy
337.article_body: Talking about the no-ball controversy during DC-RR match, DC head coach Ricky Ponting said, "Everything about it was wrong." He added, "The umpiring was wrong but you have to get on with it. For our players to remonstrate like they did and to have our assistant coach run out on the field, is not anything that we are happy with."

338.title: Yuvraj Singh trolls Shubman Gill over his 'Call Gujarat Titans for entertainment' post
338.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh trolled Gujarat Titans (GT) opener Shubman Gill over his 'Call Gujarat Titans for entertainment' post. Gill shared pictures from GT's match against SRH, which GT won by scoring 25 runs in the last over. Referring to Gill getting out for 22(24) in the match, Yuvraj wrote, "Very entertaining your shot was," and shared a slipper emoji.

339.title: Power plants getting regular coal supplies: NTPC on Delhi govt's claim
339.article_body: The National Thermal Power Corporation Limited (NTPC) has responded to Delhi government's claims that only a day or two's stock is left at the Dadri-II and Unchahar power plants. "All six units of Dadri and five units of Unchahar are running at full capacity and receiving regular coal supplies. Present stock is 1,40,000 MT and 95,000 MT respectively," said NTPC.

340.title: Fire breaks out at jewellery office in Pune; no casualties reported
340.article_body: A fire broke out at an office of gold and silver jewellery work in Raviwar Peth in Pune in the early hours of Friday. A fire officer said that the situation was brought under control in a "quick time", adding that the cause of the fire was not ascertained. No casualties were reported and nobody was injured in the incident.

341.title: Chopping, changing opening pairs not ideal: Southee on KKR's loss vs DC
341.article_body: Talking about KKR's opening combinations following their four-wicket loss against DC in IPL 2022, KKR pacer Tim Southee said that "chopping and changing" isn't ideal but it happens when the team isn't winning a lot of matches. Both openers Aaron Finch(3) and Venkatesh Iyer(6) were dismissed by DC pacer Chetan Sakariya. KKR have six losses from nine matches so far.

342.title: Bajrang Dal, VHP hold meeting with senior MNS leaders in Pune
342.article_body: Right-wing groups Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) held a meeting with senior leaders of Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) in Pune on Friday. This comes amid a controversy over loudspeakers in religious places. An MNS leader said both the groups have agreed to participate in the 'maha arti' on May 3, which will take place across Maharashtra.

343.title: Bride shot dead by man she was in relationship with at her wedding in UP
343.article_body: A bride was shot dead allegedly by her "jilted" lover at her wedding in Mathura's Mubarikpur village in Uttar Pradesh on Friday, police said. The accused had reportedly been in a relationship with the victim. "After 'Jai Mala', my daughter went to the room for refreshing up...an unknown person came in her room...shot her dead," the victim's father said.

344.title: Wreck of boat missing after accident that killed 14 found in Japan
344.article_body: The hull of a tour boat that went missing after an accident killed at least 14 people has been found underwater off the northern coast, said Japan's coast guard on Friday. The "Kazu I" went missing last Saturday off the island of Hokkaido with 26 people on board. Officials said 14 were found dead while the rest remain unaccounted for.

345.title: 7 arrested for throwing objectionable items outside mosques in UP's Ayodhya
345.article_body: Seven persons have been arrested for allegedly throwing objectionable items, including torn pages of holy books and inflammatory posters, outside three mosques and a shrine in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya, police said. It was an attempt to create communal violence and incite riots in the city, police added. Eleven persons were involved in the conspiracy and four of them are absconding.

346.title: Germany’s Scholz praises Japan for its aid to Ukraine during visit
346.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz praised Japan during a visit to the country for its support for Ukraine amid Russia's invasion. "From the start of Russia's war of aggression against Ukraine, Japan, as a G7 partner, has clearly and resolutely sided with Ukraine, Europe and the US," Scholz said. Japan is one of three Asian countries to impose sanctions on Russia.

347.title: BJP moves in right direction with right ideology: JP Nadda
347.article_body: Addressing a party programme in Ahmedabad, BJP's National President JP Nadda has said that BJP "is a party that moves in the right direction with the right ideology". "Anyone who wants to compete with our party will have to toil for 50-60 years. Our ideology is gaining global recognition...BJP is a party that...will take the country forward," Nadda said.

348.title: Pune reported 21 heat-related illnesses in March: Official
348.article_body: Maharashtra health department reported more than 300 cases of heat-related illness and 21 heatstroke deaths in March. According to State Surveillance Officer, Dr Pradip Awate, Pune reported 21 heat-related illnesses in the month of March.
