Notably, heat wave-like conditions have been prevailing over Pune as the city reported its hottest day in the season on Tuesday at 42 degrees Celsius.

349.title: Southern Command launches dedicated facility for veterans in Pune
349.article_body: The Southern Command on Thursday inaugurated a dedicated facility to address various concerns of the veterans from Pune military station. The aim of this node is to provide a single point access to the veterans, an official statement said. "It's a state-of-the-art complex with tailor-made workstations...to expeditiously provide information of various benefits and entitlements," it added.

350.title: Mumbai AC local train fare to be reduced by 50%: Union Minister Danve
350.article_body: The fare of AC local trains in Mumbai will be reduced by up to 50 percent, Union Minister Raosaheb Patil Danve said. He further informed that no changes will be made to the prices at which railway passes are sold. The existing minimum fare of ₹65 for a distance of 5 km will be reduced to ₹30, Danve said.

351.title: No such instruction: Govt on reports of halting electric 2-wheeler launches
351.article_body: The government has denied reports claiming it has asked electric two-wheeler makers to halt new launches until EV fire incidents were investigated. "There is no such instruction and such reports are unfounded, misleading and far from the truth," the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways tweeted. Earlier reports said government also cautioned manufacturers who haven't reported any fire incidents.

352.title: Mechanic dies after falling from 6th floor of Gurugram building while installing AC
352.article_body: An AC mechanic allegedly died after falling off the ledge from the sixth floor of a residential building while installing an AC in Gurugram's Sector 82. Kherki Daula SHO said the 20-year-old mechanic was repairing the AC with one leg on a concrete visor outside the window, which allegedly collapsed. He was not wearing a safety belt, the SHO added.

353.title: James Corden to step down as host of 'The Late Late Show' in 2023
353.article_body: James Corden will step down as the host of 'The Late Late Show' next year. The comedian has signed a one-year renewal contract with CBS which will come to an end by summer 2023. "It's been a really hard decision to leave because I'm so immensely proud of the show," said Corden, who began hosting the show in 2015.

354.title: Nikhil Siddhartha's father passes away, actor says 'Will miss our biryani outings'
354.article_body: Nikhil Siddhartha's father Shyam Siddhartha passed away on Thursday at a hospital in Hyderabad. The actor, who works in the Telugu film industry, took to Twitter on Friday to pen a note remembering his late father. "Our RTC XRoads movie and biryani outings, travel, laughter, summers in Mumbai...will miss them all," Nikhil wrote while sharing a picture with his father.

355.title: Ecuador lifts both outdoor, indoor mask mandates
355.article_body: President Guillermo Lasso on Thursday said Ecuador will immediately remove both its outdoor and indoor mask mandates. Lasso added the decision was based on vaccination rates of 87% of the country's population aged three and older and a COVID-19 positivity rate of 5%. "It is a clear indicator that we have practically beaten COVID-19," he said.

356.title: Snake charmer held for dancing with cobra during marriage procession in Odisha
356.article_body: Odisha's Forest Department officials arrested a snake charmer, who was found dancing with a live cobra to the tune of a 'Naagin' song during a marriage procession at Karanjia area in Mayurbhanj. The forest officers reportedly recovered three live cobras from the snake charmer Ram Singh. The officers also interrogated four associates of Ram Singh who were dancing with him.

357.title: I supported Obama, but extremists have hijacked Democratic Party now: Musk
357.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has tweeted, "I strongly supported Obama for President, but today's Democratic Party has been hijacked by extremists." Earlier, he shared a diagram showing himself once being closer to moderate liberals on the centre-left but moving closer to conservatives on the centre-right as years progressed. The diagram also showed liberals moving to extreme left thinking.

358.title: T'gana Transport Minister lays foundation stone for nursing college in Hyd
358.article_body: Telangana Transport Minister, Ajay Kumar Puvvada, on Thursday laid the foundation stone for a nursing college at TSRTC Hospital in Hyderabad. The college will have 50 seats out of which five will be allotted to children of TSRTC employees, the minister said. He also inaugurated a 20-bedded ICU and an oxygen plant among other facilities at the hospital.

359.title: Fossil of largest raptor dinosaur discovered in Argentina
359.article_body: The fossil of the largest raptor dinosaur has been discovered in Argentina's Patagonia. The new species, named Maip macrothorax, was between nine and 10 metres long. It inhibited the southern tip of Argentina 70 million years ago. These megaraptors had an agile skeleton, a long tail and neck, an elongated skull with more than 60 small teeth and sharp-ended limbs.

360.title: Anti-human trafficking police rescues 10 minors, 4 women in J'khand
360.article_body: Ten minors and four women were rescued by the Railway Protection Force's (RPF) Anti-Human Trafficking Unit in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum, an RPF officer said on Friday. The victims, who were about to board a train to Kerala's Ernakulam, were detained when they failed to give a satisfactory reply, the officer added. Some of the victims' Aadhaar cards were forged.

361.title: He knew what he was doing: Singapore on executing mentally challenged Indian-origin man
361.article_body: After 34-year-old mentally challenged Indian-origin Malaysian man, Nagaenthran Dharmalingam, was executed in a drug trafficking case in Singapore, the country's drug enforcement agency defended the execution saying Dharmalingam "knew what he was doing". It added that his actions showed he was "capable of manipulation and evasion" and he did not suffer from intellectual disability.

362.title: It's been a fresh start for us: Palak on equation with father Raja
362.article_body: Actress Palak Tiwari, daughter of Shweta Tiwari and her ex-husband Raja Chaudhary, spoke about her equation with her father and said that he's sober now and they're building their bond "from scratch". "People expect us to go back to being the perfect father-daughter duo, that's not how it works," she added. "It's been a fresh start for us," said Palak.

363.title: Will take strict action: Women commission chief on B'luru acid attack
363.article_body: After a woman was attacked with acid by a man in Bengaluru, Karnataka State Commission for Women Chairperson Pramila Naidu said that strict action would be taken against the culprit. According to police, the accused man, who had been following the woman for years, attacked her after she refused to marry him. Police have launched a hunt to nab him.

364.title: Coolest thing I've seen in a while: Mahindra on video of man driving customised vehicle
364.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted a video of a man driving a customised vehicle resembling an F1 car on an Indian road and carrying dairy products in it. "I'm not sure his vehicle meets road regulations, but I hope his passion for wheels remains unregulated," wrote Mahindra. "This is the coolest thing I've seen in...a long while," he added.

365.title: Ex-IAS officer Faesal reinstated 3 yrs after quitting, says 'idealism let me down'
365.article_body: Former IAS officer Shah Faesal, who had quit the service in 2019 citing 'rising intolerance' in India, has been allowed to rejoin by the government. The 2009 batch UPSC topper had an eight-month-long stint in politics and was detained after Article 370 was abrogated. Referring to the period, Faesal said, "I lost almost everything...I'd built...My idealism had let me down."

366.title: Stones pelted, swords brandished during anti-Khalistan protest in Punjab's Patiala
366.article_body: Violence broke out between Shiv Sena and pro-Khalistani Sikh organisations on Friday over the former's anti-Khalistan protest near Shri Kali Devi Temple in Punjab's Patiala. Police personnel reportedly had to open fire and use tear gas shells to maintain law and order. In a video footage, pro-Khalistani groups were purportedly seen brandishing swords and pelting stones at Shiv Sena workers.

367.title: You almost broke my leg in my early 20s: AB de Villiers to Shoaib Akhtar
367.article_body: Recalling a match between South Africa and Pakistan, ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers told ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar on Twitter, "You almost broke my leg...in my early twenties after I decided to pull you for a six." "The minute it hit my bat I knew it was a big mistake," De Villiers wrote.

368.title: Zuckerberg's wealth increases by $11 billion in his biggest one-day gain ever
368.article_body: Meta Platforms' 37-year-old CEO Mark Zuckerberg added $11 billion to his fortune in the biggest one-day gain he has ever had, Bloomberg reported. His personal wealth surged as Meta shares soared 17.6% on Thursday after it reported that Facebook added more users than expected in first quarter of 2022. Zuckerberg is now the world's 12th-richest person with $75.9 billion wealth.

369.title: Tharoor pens poem on Kejriwal's sitting posture during meeting with PM Modi
369.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has penned a poem on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's sitting posture during a virtual meeting with PM Narendra Modi. "There once was a CM of Delhi, who stretched from his head to his belly. The onscreen reticulation, revealed his pandiculation. So BJP frothed & quivered like jelly!" Tharoor wrote. BJP Delhi had called Kejriwal "mannerless CM".

370.title: Umran's first ball to Hardik was absolute fire, he was stunned: Swann
370.article_body: Ex-England cricketer Graeme Swann said SRH pacer Umran Malik's first delivery to GT captain Hardik Pandya in SRH's loss against GT was "absolute fire" and "stunned" Hardik. "Umran then bowled a rapid short delivery...got Hardik out," added Swann. Discussing the T20 World Cup 2022, Swann stated, "I will take Umran to Australia. Jasprit Bumrah's quick but...[not] express like Umran."

371.title: Activision Blizzard shareholders approve $68.7 bn Microsoft deal
371.article_body: Call of Duty-maker Activision Blizzard's shareholders have approved Microsoft's $68.7 billion proposal to buy the firm. Over 98% of the shares voted at a special meeting were in favour of the proposed transaction. Microsoft announced in January that it had agreed to acquire Activision Blizzard in its biggest acquisition to date. Microsoft's $26.2 billion LinkedIn acquisition is its second-biggest.

372.title: Rickshaw driver held for abetting suicide of live-in partner in Maharashtra
372.article_body: A 32-year-old rickshaw driver was arrested on Friday for allegedly abetting the suicide of his 28-year-old live-in partner in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi, police said. The woman had parted ways with her husband due to domestic issues and had been living with the rickshaw driver for two years, police added. The woman allegedly hanged herself due to frequent harassment, police stated.

373.title: I have stolen one of the things that Nadal did on clay: Naomi Osaka
373.article_body: Talking about Rafael Nadal, ex-world number one Naomi Osaka said she has stolen one of the things that Nadal did when playing matches on clay courts, adding that it will either go really well or very badly. "I know that every kid growing up playing tennis in the world has pretended to be Nadal at least once," stated Osaka.

374.title: Heat wave warning issued for 15 states/UTs over 5 days, IMD releases list
374.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued heat wave warning for 15 states/UTs over five days. The states/UTs are: Rajasthan, Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, Delhi, Chandigarh, Uttar Pradesh, Telangana, Jharkhand, Bihar, Odisha, West Bengal, Chhattisgarh and Gujarat. On Thursday, the IMD had issued orange alert for Rajasthan, Delhi, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh and Odisha.

375.title: PM Modi inaugurates Semicon India 2022 conference in Bengaluru
375.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday inaugurated Semicon India 2022 conference in Bengaluru, saying, "Semiconductors are playing a critical role in the world in more ways than we can imagine." The conference is being organised by India Semiconductor Mission. "It's our collective aim to establish India as one of the key partners in the global semiconductors supply chain," PM Modi added.

376.title: Drugs worth ₹4.50 crore seized in Assam's Morigaon, 3 arrested
376.article_body: Three people were arrested after Assam Police seized a huge quantity of drugs worth around ₹4.50 crore from their possession in Morigaon district. The accused have been identified as Basir Khan, Altaf Khan and Jahidul Ali. "We have apprehended three persons and seized two trucks and a pick-up van. The seized trucks were coming from Manipur," police said.

377.title: Taapsee Pannu-starrer 'Shabaash Mithu' to release on July 15
377.article_body: Taapsee Pannu on Friday took to Instagram to announce the release date of her upcoming film 'Shabaash Mithu'. The film, helmed by Srijit Mukherji, will release on July 15. "There is nothing more powerful than a girl with a dream and a plan to realise it!" wrote Taapsee, who essays the role of Indian cricketer Mithali Raj in the film.

378.title: I am nobody to decide role of Rahul Gandhi in Cong: Prashant Kishor
378.article_body: Prashant Kishor rejected reports which claimed that he suggested the name of Priyanka Gandhi to lead the Congress party and said that there was "no discussion" of Rahul or Priyanka in his meeting with party leaders. Kishor further said that he was nobody to decide the role of Rahul Gandhi in Congress. Kishor had recently declined offer to join Congress.

379.title: Video shows duo attacking 26-yr-old with a sword in Kalyan; booked
379.article_body: Police have booked two youths, identified as Nagesh Dalvi and Sandeep Rathore, after a video of them attacking 26-year-old Ajay Shirath with a sword at Kalyan's Mhasoba Chowk went viral on social media. Infuriated over an old dispute, the accused reportedly abused and attacked Shirath while he was crossing the street with a friend. He sustained injuries and was hospitalised.

380.title: US reports its 1st human H5 bird flu case
380.article_body: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has confirmed that the first known human case of H5 bird flu in the US has been confirmed in a prison inmate in Colorado. The person was involved in the culling of poultry presumed to have had H5N1 bird flu, the CDC said. The man experienced only fatigue.

381.title: Neetu Kapoor breaks down remembering Rishi Kapoor on reality show
381.article_body: Neetu Kapoor broke down in an episode of the reality show 'Dance Deewane Juniors' after a contestant's grandmother sang the song 'Lambi Judaai' while remembering late actor Rishi Kapoor. The actress, who's a judge on the show, said, "Rishi ji is not here but...every day, someone reminds me of him. Somehow, somewhere, he is still connected to me."

382.title: Amazon reports its first quarterly loss since 2015, loses $3.8 billion
382.article_body: E-commerce giant Amazon reported its first quarterly loss since 2015. Amazon's net loss for the first quarter of 2022 was $3.8 billion. "It...includes a pre-tax valuation loss of $7.6 billion included in non-operating expense from our common stock investment in Rivian Automotive," Amazon said. "Pandemic and subsequent war in Ukraine...brought unusual growth and challenges," CEO Andy Jassy stated.

383.title: Controversial slogans come up on walls of BHU campus; removed
383.article_body: Controversial slogans that had come up on the walls of Banaras Hindu University (BHU) campus in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi were removed on Thursday by the proctorial board's security and police personnel. The slogans were attributed to a BHU student organisation. However, the student organisation denied any involvement and termed it to be a "conspiracy" by anti-social elements to defame it.

384.title: When mom doesn't like my film, she says 'hatao, ye kya banaya hai?': Aamir
384.article_body: Aamir Khan in a recent interview spoke about how his mother responds when she doesn't like his films. "When she doesn't like something, she says 'Hatao, ye kya banaya hai?' (Put it away, what have you made)," he said. Speaking about his mother's reaction to the test screening of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', Aamir said she liked the film a lot.

385.title: Following Musk's life is like taking notes while drinking from fire hose: Biographer
385.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's biographer Walter Isaacson has said dealing with Musk's life is "like trying to take notes while drinking from a fire hose. It keeps coming fast". He added everybody wants to talk about Musk and "everybody's got thoughts about him". "I don't think he's as random as he allows himself to appear," Isaacson said.

386.title: Telangana govt and Google sign pact for skill training of youth, women
386.article_body: Telangana government on Thursday signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Google to provide skill training to the youth and women of the state. Under the agreement, Google will collaborate with state government to provide Google Career Certificate Scholarships to the youth. Further, Google will also start a "WomenWill" programme to train women in business and financial skills.

387.title: Mumbai-based lecturer duped of ₹80,000 while booking heli service
387.article_body: A Mumbai-based college assistant lecturer was duped of ₹80,000 by a cyber fraudster when the former was trying to book a helicopter ride from Sirsi (Karnataka) to Kedarnath (Uttarakhand). The 53-year-old complainant, who goes on Kedarnath Yatra every year, alleged that he was duped while booking the service for a group of 17 people, including him, through a website.

388.title: 5 policemen injured after scuffle with VHP members in Noida
388.article_body: At least five policemen were injured after a scuffle broke out between them and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) members outside Noida's Sector 39 Police Station. "A group of people from VHP came...to get a person, who has been accused of rape, released," an official said. "An argument ensued and it turned into a scuffle," the official added.

389.title: Groom's family halts wedding over ladoos in Chhattisgarh
389.article_body: Upset over not serving ladoos, the groom's family allegedly halted a wedding in Chhattisgarh's Mungeli district. The groom's side reportedly objected to ladoos not being served during the wedding, which led to a brawl between them and the bride's side. When the matter reached the police station, cops intervened to settle the dispute, following which the marriage was solemnised.

390.title: Apple's Q2 revenue rises 9% y-o-y to record $97.3 billion
390.article_body: Apple announced that it has posted a March quarter revenue record of $97.3 billion, up 9% year-over-year. Its total profit was $25 billion up from over $23 billion recorded in the same period last year. Its iPad sales revenue fell 2% to $7.65 billion due to supply-chain constraints, while revenue from Mac computers rose 14.7% to $10.4 billion.

391.title: Chhattisgarh CM flags off 61 new vehicles to check crimes on highways
391.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel flagged off 61 new patrolling vehicles to prevent human trafficking and other crimes on the highways. Tweeting pictures from the event on Thursday, Baghel informed that out of the total vehicles, 15 will be dedicated for highway patrolling, 24 for anti-human trafficking and 22 for maintaining law and order in the state.

392.title: I feel embarrassed on the pitch, it's too painful: Man Utd’s De Gea
392.article_body: Manchester United goalkeeper David De Gea said he feels "embarrassed" and "horrible" while playing for United. "When you are...3-0 or 4-0 down, it is too painful," added De Gea. "It is tough, I have been here for many years," stated De Gea. Manchester United are currently sixth on the Premier League points table and trail fourth-placed Arsenal by five points.

393.title: Bus conductor killed as 3 buses catch fire in Punjab's Bathinda
393.article_body: A bus conductor was killed after three buses caught fire on Thursday night at Bhagta Bhai Ka town in Punjab's Bathinda, police said. The conductor was sleeping in one of the buses when the incident occurred at the bus stand, police added. "There were three employees of a private transport company guarding their two buses," police further said.

394.title: Which states/UTs are on the brink of power outage amid heatwave?
394.article_body: India is witnessing the worst electricity shortage in over six years amid the heatwave. Several states/UTs are on the brink of power outage due to the increased demand of coal. They include Delhi, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Andhra Pradesh, Bihar, Rajasthan, Kerala and Punjab. The electricity demand shot up by 40% in Punjab, while in Rajasthan, it has increased by 31%.

395.title: Hundreds of passenger trains cancelled for movement of coal amid power crisis
395.article_body: Hundreds of passenger trains have been cancelled for movement of coal carriages amid power crisis in India. Several parts of India are facing long hours of blackouts, while some industries are cutting output due to the fossil fuel's shortage. The measure is temporary and passenger services will be restored as soon as the situation normalises, an Indian Railways official said.

396.title: Ammonia leaks from H'yana factory; breathing difficulties reported
396.article_body: Workers at a factory in Haryana's Jhajjar were evacuated and water was sprayed after the factory reported an ammonia gas leak on Thursday night. Some residents in the area complained of difficulty in breathing and vomiting, while the condition of two firefighters reportedly also deteriorated during the relief work. Meanwhile, the Additional Deputy Commissioner advised people to wear masks.

397.title: Violence doesn’t benefit anybody: Mohan Bhagwat on communal violence incidents
397.article_body: Speaking about the communal clashes which erupted in some states during Ram Navami and Hanuman Jayanti, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that violence does not benefit anybody. "The society to which violence is dear is now counting its last days...For this, it is essential to bring together all communities...We all need to do this work on a priority," Bhagwat said.

398.title: Illegal arms dealer held in Kolkata, 2 country-made pistols recovered
398.article_body: The Special Task Force of Kolkata Police arrested an illegal arms dealer from city's Parsi Bagan lane area on Thursday. The police also recovered two country-made improvised firearms along with other items. The accused, identified as Ajijur Momin, is a resident of Malda. He will be produced before the court on Friday.

399.title: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp extends contract until 2026
399.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp has signed a contract extension until 2026 with his previous deal due to expire in 2024. "There is a freshness about us as a club...and this energises me," said Klopp. Ex-Liverpool player José Enrique had earlier tweeted that Klopp's contract extension is better than Liverpool signing forwards Kylian Mbappé and Erling Haaland at the same time.

400.title: Real tech skills lead to remarkable outcomes: Scaler
400.article_body: Scaler Academy highlights the value of real tech skills for impactful career results. It promises the right learning environment including dedicated mentorship & an industry-fit curriculum taught by experienced instructors. From achieving 126% average salary hike to being placed at top tech companies like Amazon, Microsoft, Flipkart & more, our alumni utilise skills to create impact, said Scaler.

401.title: Boman shares pic with Vicky, Anupam; fan says 'Too much talent in 1 frame'
401.article_body: Taking to Instagram, Boman Irani shared a picture of himself with Anupam Kher and Vicky Kaushal. "He's what we call 'a good lad'...A gentle soul and a lot more dear, Vicky Kaushal," he wrote. Reacting to Boman's post, a fan wrote, "Too much talent in one frame," while another said, "It'd be good to see...three of you together on screen."
